metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4762 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
WebKit in Apple iOS before 10, iTunes before 12.5.1 on Windows, iCloudbefore 6.0 on Windows, and Safari before 10 allows remote attackers toexecute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption) viaa crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4762` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
webkit2gtk package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.14.2-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no update available').
